FuncDef:
The auto-defend alarm threshold command sets the event reporting threshold for attack source tracing.
The undo auto-defend alarm threshold command restores the default event reporting threshold for attack source tracing. The auto-defend alarm threshold command sets the event reporting threshold for attack source tracing. The undo auto-defend alarm threshold command restores the default event reporting threshold for attack source tracing. By default, the event reporting threshold for attack source tracing is 128 pps.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the event reporting threshold for attack source tracing.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535. The default value is 128.

ExtraInfo: When the number of packets of a specified protocol from an attack source exceeds the threshold in a specified period, the device reports an event to the administrator so that the administrator can take measures to protect the device.
